segment.source: This policy setting determines whether LAN Manager is prevented from storing hash values for the new password the next time the password is changed.
segment.target: This policy setting determines whether LAN Manager is prevented from storing hash values for the new password the next time the password is changed.

segment.source: Hash values are a representation of the password after the encryption algorithm is applied that corresponds to the format that is specified by the algorithm.
segment.target: Hash values are a representation of the password after the encryption algorithm is applied that corresponds to the format that is specified by the algorithm.

segment.source: To decrypt the hash value, the encryption algorithm must be determined and then reversed.
segment.target: To decrypt the hash value, the encryption algorithm must be determined and then reversed.

segment.source: The LAN Manager hash is relatively weak and prone to attack compared to the cryptographically stronger NTLM hash.
segment.target: The LAN Manager hash is relatively weak and prone to attack compared to the cryptographically stronger NTLM hash.

segment.source: Because the LM hash is stored on the local device in the security database, the passwords can be compromised if the security database, Security Accounts Manager (SAM), is attacked.
segment.target: Because the LM hash is stored on the local device in the security database, the passwords can be compromised if the security database, Security Accounts Manager (SAM), is attacked.

segment.source: By attacking the SAM file, attackers can potentially gain access to user names and password hashes.
segment.target: By attacking the SAM file, attackers can potentially gain access to user names and password hashes.

segment.source: Attackers can use a password-cracking tool to determine what the password is.
segment.target: Attackers can use a password-cracking tool to determine what the password is.

segment.source: After they have access to this information, they can use it to gain access to resources on your network by impersonating users.
segment.target: After they have access to this information, they can use it to gain access to resources on your network by impersonating users.

segment.source: Enabling this policy setting will not prevent these types of attacks, but it will make them much more difficult.
segment.target: Enabling this policy setting will not prevent these types of attacks, but it will make them much more difficult.

segment.source: Set Network security: Do not store LAN Manager hash value on next password change to Enabled.
segment.target: Set Network security: Do not store LAN Manager hash value on next password change to Enabled.

segment.source: Require all users to set new passwords the next time they log on to the domain so that LAN Manager hashes are removed.
segment.target: Require all users to set new passwords the next time they log on to the domain so that LAN Manager hashes are removed.
